description: XRIPL is a library of tools for processing x-ray radiographs and extracting contours of interest within the image using computer vision techniques. Features include spatial calibration, denoising, background and attenuation correction through pseudo-flatfielding, watershed segmentation, contour processing, and visualization. The details of the XRIPL analysis pipeline are published in the Proceedings of the 23rd Topical Conference on High-Temperature Plasma Diagnostics Proceedings (LA-UR-20-30133) [1]. [1] P. M. Kozlowski, Y. Kim, B. M. Haines, H. F. Robey, T. J. Murphy, H. M. Johns, and T. S. Perry. Use of Computer Vision for analysis of image data sets from high temperature plasma experiments. Review of Scientific Instruments 92, 033532 (2021) https://doi.org/10.1063/5.0040285
name: XRIPL
